boardgame.description: Descent: Journeys in the Dark is a semi-cooperative game in which two to five players will take on the antagonistic roles of heroes and Overlord. Up to four players will choose characters with a wide assortment of skills and innate abilities to be the heroes who will explore dungeons in search of treasure and adventure. One player will take on the role of the Overlord and will control the dungeon's many traps, puzzles, and monsters._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The heroes' goal will be to cooperatively conquer the dungeon, seize its many treasures, and achieve other objectives as set by the scenario. If the heroes cooperate and achieve their goals, they will all win. The Overlord's objective is simply to use all the means at his or her disposal - from deadly traps and ferocious monsters - to kill the heroes. Each hero has a certain Conquest Point value to the party and if too many Conquest Points are lost through hero death, the party loses and the Overlord wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Re-implemented by:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) (2012)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Well, I hate to have to get rid of it because its the most fun looking game I have and makes me feel like a kid just looking at the box. But with a couple kids now I just don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t see my wife and friends and I ever having the time to get through it again. Its a long game, very long, but very fun. We only played it three times. So, everything is here and well cared for. The figures are bagged and all of the chits are organized in a plastic craft container box. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m including the craft box and trust me you want it. If you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re really picky about how your games look, like I am, here_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s the parts you want to pay attention to. I thought I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;d try my hand at painting some of the figures. I got 6 skeletons primed, and 3 of those fully painted and then realized how foolish I was for thinking I wanted to paint. We never played again after that but later I went back and stripped all of the paint off of them and it mostly worked. The 3 that were primed look almost like original with an occasional speck of gray. Not bad. The 3 that were painted came clean as well but anything that was painted brown sort of stained the mini. Its light, but noticeable. The hero figures were tough for me to determine who was who when we_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;d set up for play. There_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s a lot of them. So I took a fine tipped sharpie and wrote the names of the heroes on the underside of their bases. Not noticeable in play. A few of the mini_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s are fragile. One of the spiders was popped off its base when I got it new but it easily reseated. When I got the game out to check it over (been in storage for 6 years) 2 more spiders had popped off. I super-glued them back on and they look like new. So just be aware, it can happen but a little glue does the trick. Other than that everything is in super shape. Box is still very nice with only a small tear/scratch on one side. I have extensive pics of it all so please shoot me a message so you can take a look at them and decide for yourself. Please message me with any questions you might have and thanks for browsing. Hopefully you can give this amazing box of fun stuff some more play. And P.S., this is obviously the first edition big box. Its big, its heavy. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m not sure what its going to cost to ship but it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll be relatively high. If you happen to live in the Charlotte, NC area we can meet up for face to face delivery and save shipping.
